result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A Ferrell

records.addlTxt:
8:37 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense files a bond motion on case on 21CF330.  State has not tendered a final offer.  The new file has not had a PH yet.  Court will change the 22CF1193 case to a PH.  Court will set a new status on all tracking files 30 days after.  State will tender a global offer after the PH.  Defense makes further argument on bond.  State objects.  BTC: Bond modification denied.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:01 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Atty Jeremy Samuels for Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defendant has a new charge and prelim is next week.  ADA Van Schyndel will provide a global offer after the prelim.  The defendant complains to the court about the communication with his attorney.  Atty Samuels to notify atty Henderson.  The defendant wants a global offer next week.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:59 AM Defendant David A Ferrell in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for David A Ferrell.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  21CF1300 is set for trial next week.  Defense is requesting an adj.  Deft. has new charges and an INIT on Sept. 27, the parties are working on a global offer.  BTC: Vacate Warrant on case 21CF330.  Defense gives explanation for the non-appearance.  Defendant has many court cases with many different dates and was confused on the dates.  Defense asks that the bond be reinstated.  State responds.  State defers to the court on bond.  Court admonishes the defendant.  BTC: Bond set at $2000 cash, same conditions.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim D.B (person, property, residence or family).

Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
